intro: Operculina aegyptia, commonly known as the Egyptian operculina, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with red veins and hairy, palmately lobed leaves. It typically grows as an annual herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, aiding in its spread across suitable habitats.
